Topic.Title: What I have trouble with is that YHOO is stuck at $15 while since it was offered....

Message.Msg: Yahoo is a slow website that gets its email accounts hacked every 3 months. Finding sports scores takes all day. AND, since Yahoo makes money every quarter where is the DIV.... Should be getting .30 a year in DIVS. I will never get how people invest in stocks that do not pay you. After getting my email account hacked again i just shorted this crap stock 5000@ $15. I predict a 15k x-mass present when i dump it at $12 on 12/21/2012...............

Message.Title: Yahoo in the midst of selling its stake in Yahoo! Japan back to Softbank
Message.Msg: Yahoo! is in the midst of selling its stake in Yahoo! Japan back to Softbank. Mayer would know the current status of the talks, but they appear to be close. Assuming Yahoo! can close the deal in the next three months, the cash-rich split deal would see Yahoo getting $3 billion in cash back tax-free and $1.5 billion worth of "other assets" tax-free.

Topic.Title: Yahoo in the midst of selling its stake in Yahoo! Japan back to Softbank

Message.Msg: Chances are high that Yahoo! will get its hands on the cash and assets from the Yahoo! Japan deal sooner than it will the cash from the Alibaba deal. Eric Jackson-

Message.Title: YAHOO FESS UP
Message.Msg: I posted yesterday that my Yahoo email account was hacked again. The last time this happened about a month laster there was a small mention on CNBC that 450000 yahoo accounts were hacked. Fess up Yahoo. They know there are being hacked from the Ukraine and where is the press release or notice to Yahoo users about this. The thread i put up yesterday was deleted. They pull in over 1.2B a year. After i am able to change my info on other accounts i will no longer visit yahoo and have been a user since day one. My contacts are getting sick of the bogus emailos sent from my account from the hackers in the Ukraine. If anyone out there thinks this company will be bought you may be right. But not at $15. Maybe $10. I have never messed with this stock but i had to short it this morning after the email hack again. I do the fantasy sports and use Yahoo daily but as i said after this week Yahoo is off my browser. I am not a paid pumper or dumper. Only think you should know what Yahoo will not tell you. Lets see how long yahoo allows this thread to stay. Good luck Guys......

Topic.Title: Marissa can't speak for herself_ so X-Yahoo Krisnan spoke for her?

Message.Msg: Doesn't sound like a CEO laugh. Let a geek be geek, she might not be an ideal CEO for a mature company like Yahoo..... but for a start-up she might be perfect- start up is all about product development less public interaction like media and wall street and investors. Look at how she handled the redeployment of capital and leave everyone hanging about her plan for acquisitions and product development..... while the stock got hit for 10%. A leader lead with vision not "guess what I am going to do next". She's been on the job for a month now, no clear mission statement, just free lunch for SURVIVING EMPLOYEES. Kind of like a last meal before execution. Marissa might make a good executioner and a tyrant. She works on a need to know basis.

Message.Title: Lies, Lies ,Lies and
Message.Msg: more lies. What ever happened to all the bids for Yahoo ?? One big distraction because they had to keep the stock from collapsing. They pretend to be doing all these things for stockholders but it comes down to a lack of incompetent leadership and the hunt and search continues, and continues. The only stockholders hanging around are the ones who believe things can't any worse and have to reverse course eventually.

Topic.Title: Is it time to write Dan Loeb a letter?

Message.Msg: And tell him what that he hasn't already figured out? -That he is in the process of blowing what was once a reputation as a savvy investor? -That Yahoo is staffed by incompetents? -That the corporate culture is one of lying? -That an overpriced acquisition will probably push the stock down and eventually result in a writeoff because the acquired management will bail and nobody at Yahoo can manage what they have much less anything new? -That the only way he will ever get his money out now is to find a buyer for the various parts of Yahoo? Anything else?

Topic.Title: Marissa neeeds to be told point blank by the BOD

Message.Msg: Well that's ridiculous! Yes the BOD make a big mistake in hiring an inexperienced "virgin" CEO, who is pregnant, at a time when YHOO desperately needed stability, and experience, and had a great candidate in house in Levinsohn. The only answer now is to get YHOO sold to MSFT, AAPL, etc. Clearly she should not get rid of the baby but if she quits or is removed we will have our sixth CEO in a year. Hell at 5 in a year YHOO must already have the record for a bil $ plus company.

Message.Title: way to much turnover yr after yr, its all got to end
Message.Msg: ceo after ceo, resignation after resignation of top ex's, this has to stop cause its not good for business or the company morale, do you really think this one woman after all these yrs of yhoo screwing up is gonna turn the ship around. someting big has to happen and soon, like being sold, going private or what have you. i'm sorry, common sense shows she is not gonna be able to do this. please sell this company, tired of all this dead money for the past 4 yrs now.

Message.Title: Wonder what the BOD was thinking in not hiring Levinsohn, who was doing a great job, was....
Message.Msg: ...well liked and experienced at YHOO, and instead taking the huge gamble on a young, inexperienced woman (and with so much YHOO value and dealings in Asia where women simply are NOT respected) who was 6 months pregnant no less?? To me Levinsohn looked like a much better candidate than Scott Thompson (what were they thinking there, that he could be a yes man to Yang and Bostock?) and after they made that clear mistake, why not go with the obvious choice and have Levinsohn just work to get YHOO sold ASAP for the most money. Now all YHOO has is doubt and uncertainty. YHOO sucks in so many ways! Just sell the company!
